description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1a0sr","text":"This protocol describes experiments performed to quantify pressure and volume variations inside fluid-walled dumbbells when a pressure difference is generated between the two chambers. Difference in Laplace pressure automatically flows medium from the high-pressure chamber to the low pressure one. Flow stops when pressures are equilibrated.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Laplace pressure, automatic flow, dumbbell circuits, fluid-walled microfluidics

parent_collections.title: Do, Q. B. & Nebuloni, F. et al. (2023) A fluid walled microfluidic platform for human neuronal microcircuits and axotomy.
Do, Q. B. & Nebuloni, F. et al. (2023) A fluid walled microfluidic platform for human neuronal microcircuits and axotomy.

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a8dlu","text":"Fill a virgin uniwell plate with 5 ml of DMEM supplemented with 10% FBS. Agitate the plate to spread the 5 mL of medium to cover the whole area of the plate.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f60b0","text":"Remove the volume leaving a thin layer of medium wetting the plate. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1c9c","text":"Gently overlay FC40 (~50 mL) pouring it in one of the corners. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8nfjg","text":"","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7qbt1","text":"Place the plate in the 3D traverse. Adjust x, y, z positions of the traverse head to coincide with the starting point of the movement path. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dhtto","text":"Start the pump, setting a constant flow at 480 μL/min.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2umqs","text":"Start traverse automatic movement. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6rk3q","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2fj8j","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":6,"offset":56}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f3icp","text":"Traverse movements are controlled by scripts written in G-code.","type":"align-justify"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"8198F031EFE011ED917A555B25A4F49B","url":"https://github.com/craggASAP/microfluid_axotomy.git"},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"link"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2e5us","text":"At completion of the movement path, stop pump and remove plate from the traverse. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bodl7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ee03f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f5s26","text":"The 3D traverse consists of 3 orthogonal screws that allow head movement along Cartesian axes. Traverse moving head holds a blunt needle (inner diameter = 70 um) connected to an external syringe pump through a Teflon tube. The syringe on the pump and the whole tubing/needle is prefilled with FC40.","type":"align-justify"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Establishment of Pressure Difference and Volumes Variation Measurements
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"930fg","text":"Place the newly printed plate into the pendant drop tensiometry machine.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Establishment of Pressure Difference and Volumes Variation Measurements
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"arob0","text":"Add FC40 to almost fill the plate entirely (~20 mL).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Establishment of Pressure Difference and Volumes Variation Measurements
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6l026","text":"By mean of a syringe pump connected to a needle through a Teflon tube, infuse 4 μL in the right chamber and soon after 1 μL in the left chamber (infusion rate set on pump = 20 μl/min).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Establishment of Pressure Difference and Volumes Variation Measurements
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5lkp5","text":"Record chambers height for 24 hours imaging every 30 minutes.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2pk3i","text":"Wait ~10 s to allow flow to be fully developed.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
